intro: Sisymbrium acutangulum var. angustatum, commonly known as narrowleaf sweet-cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. It produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in sunny environments.
